intro: Amomum flavoalbum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered cardamom, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, fragrant leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine and culinary applications. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and medicinal purposes.
